p: While the GHG emission abatement policies POL3.7 and POL4.5 slightly reduce the mean increase in total runoff over the United States by curtailing the increase in precipitation, they also have a lessening effect on water requirements—due in part to a decrease in thermo‐electric power generation and associated cooling water demand—with the smallest increase expected under the most stringent emissions scenario POL3.7 (when considering the ensemble mean).
